presentation_text: I create elegant web solutions with a focus on simplicity and functionality.
presentation_description: I see web development as an opportunity to solve real-world problems by creating effective and accessible solutions. My varied experiences have taught me to adapt to the specific needs of each project and to commit to continuously improving my skills. I enjoy exploring new technologies to stay current and deliver modern solutions tailored to each challenge.
teaching-assistant-description: As a Pedagogical Coordinator at Epitech Strasbourg, I am responsible for guiding first, second, and third-year students. My role includes supervising pedagogical activities and grading projects.
yanport-description: As a Fullstack Developer at Yanport, I was part of a ten-developer team focused on developing and maintaining a complex application with five main tools. My role involved integrating new features based on mockups in close collaboration with the product owner, while also handling bug fixes and tickets through internal tools and Zendesk. I contributed to improving the CI/CD pipeline for faster and more reliable deployments and enhanced the codebase through refactorings for better maintainability. All tasks were completed using an agile methodology. My tech stack included Angular, Angular Material, Typescript, Cypress, and Java, which I used to deliver robust solutions tailored to the needs of real estate agents, Yanportâ€™s primary clients.
cypios-description: As a Frontend Developer at Cypios, I joined a fully remote team of four developers to create a medical solution aimed at improving patient follow-up by doctors in the field of oncology, in preparation for its launch. My work involved integrating new features based on mockups and following agile methodologies. The technical stack included React.js, Material UI, Typescript, Formik, and Cypress.
epita-description: As a Teaching Assistant at Epita, my mission was to assist students with their projects during UNIX lab sessions, focusing on C and Bash. My responsibilities included guiding students through project implementations and evaluating their work.
epitech-description: As a Pedagogical Assistant at Epitech, I was part of a team of six assistants responsible for guiding first-year students through their projects. My tasks included project explanation, supervision of pedagogical activities, and grading.
chrome-finance-description: As a Frontend Developer at Chrome Finance, my role was to create a website to increase the company's visibility to new clients. I was responsible for designing the website and organizing relevant information for display.
numendo-description: As a Frontend Developer at Numendo, I joined a team of developers responsible for creating and maintaining websites for various companies. My role involved web page integration and developing a custom WordPress theme, along with building an internal application for employee training.
calendify-description: Calendify is a modern calendar application designed to help appointment scheduling. This project was developed as part of a technical challenge to demonstrate capabilities in creating full-stack applications with an emphasis on clean, functional UI and efficient backend services.
